means: （因寒冷或恐惧而引起的）鸡皮疙瘩

sentence.Network_en: It was so cold I was gooseflesh all over.

The whole body breaks out with " gooseflesh ".

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: so named because the skin resembles that of a plucked goose

means.word_mean: 1. reflex erection of hairs of the skin in response to cold or emotional stress or skin irritation

auth_sentence.content: She was just back from Sydney, where she had appeared at a food-and-wine festival, but her skin was as pale as gooseflesh.

means.word_mean: (因寒冷或恐惧而引起的)鸡皮疙瘩

sentences.en: Ann, put on your sweater; you’re so cold you have gooseflesh on your arms.
sentences.cn: 安，把毛线衫穿上，你冷了，手臂上都起鸡皮疙瘩了。
